pullRequest.body:
The map`stoneCechUnit` is injective when the underlying space is a `T35Space`.

---

nodes.body: Thanks for the feedback @jcommelin. I made some changes and tried to improve the PR a little bit overall.

### PR summary [2f212b1933](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/12536/commits/2f212b1933ad0e5098397df38142ead69f7aee82)

<details><summary>

#### Import changes for modified files

</summary>

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.Topology.CompletelyRegular | 1191 | 1192 | +1 (+0.08%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Topology.CompletelyRegular`|1|

</details>

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ eq_if_stoneCechUnit_eq`
`+ injective_stoneCechUnit_of_t35Space`
`+ separatesPoints_continuous_of_t35Space_Icc`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>
Thanks for the comments @YaelDillies. Updated accordingly

There have been some changes in how the Stone Cech compactification is constructed. This PR doesn't seem to work out of the box under that update. I'll have to spend some time looking at this, when I have the opportunity. Converted to a draft with the intention to signal that.

> There have been some changes in how the Stone Cech compactification is constructed. This PR doesn't seem to work out of the box under that update.

Yes, those changes were precisely motivated by your PR. I couldn’t let you suffer with universes like that. I am really sorry it took so long. I fixed your PR. Thanks for you contribution!

bors merge

Let's try again

bors merge

Build failed (retrying...):
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9986364273/job/27598751439)

Build failed (retrying...):
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9986951659/job/27600390616)

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9988145131/job/27603974291)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9988145131/job/27603975196)
The names look "okay" to me, but maybe the topologists have better suggestions
The names look "okay" to me, but maybe the topologists have better suggestions

```suggestion
lemma injective_stoneCechUnit_t35Space [T35Space X] :
```

Could you please extract this as saying that there is a continuous function to `I` that separates the points?
I understand that the `ULift` is a bit annoying. But I think the statement without the `ULift` is useful as a standalone result.

Thanks @jcommelin. That separate lemma would then be
```
SeparatesPoints (Continuous : Set (X → I))
```
right?
There has to be a better way to invoke `separatesPoints_continuous_of_t35Space_compact_t2` here, right? I just couldn't figure out how.
Yes, make `X` an explicit argument in `separatesPoints_continuous_of_t35Space_compact_t2`
This also seems like something I shouldn't need to write. Tips appreciated

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion SeparatesPoints (Continuous : Set (X → I)) := by ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion ∃ (Z : Type u) (_ : TopologicalSpace Z) (_ : T2Space Z) (_ : CompactSpace Z), ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion ∃ (Z : Type u) (_ : TopologicalSpace Z) (_ : T2Space Z) (_ : CompactSpace Z), ```

```suggestion
      SeparatesPoints (Continuous : Set (X → Z)) := by
```

You can then do 
```suggestion
  obtain ⟨_, _, _, _, sep⟩ := separatesPoints_continuous_of_t35Space_compact_t2 X
```

The interval names are an exception to the `lowerCamelCase` convention
```suggestion
lemma separatesPoints_continuous_of_t35Space_Icc [T35Space X] :
```

```suggestion
lemma separatesPoints_continuous_of_t35Space_compact_t2 [T35Space X] :
```
since it's a typeclass. Same below

```suggestion
lemma separatesPoints_continuous_compact_t2_of_t35Space (hX : T35Space X) :
```
or something like that? `compact_t2` doesn't refer to an assumption

```suggestion
lemma eq_of_stoneCechUnit_eq_stoneCechUnit {a b : α} {f : α → γ} (hcf : Continuous f) :
```
or you could state your result using `Function.FactorsThrough`
Could you have a version stated using `Function.FactorsThrough`?

Pointy brackets right-associate
```suggestion
  obtain ⟨f, fc, fab⟩ := sep hab
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Topology): stoneCechUnit injective for T35Space
